Html:
Im creating a windows forms app. I've added the functionality that when a user double clicks on the map, it centers and zooms in at the double click location. This works fine.

My issue is when the user double taps the screen(Microsoft Surface Pro 2). Everything gets called the same way as the double click, but when I try to assign the myMap.Zoom a new value, myMap.Zoom doesnt get changed to the new value..

At the point in the program where the value is changing, there shouldn't be any difference between a mouse click and a tap. It just doesnt work when the tap triggers the event to begin with.
    Private Sub myMap_MouseDoubleClick(sender As Object, e As MouseEventArgs) Handles myMap.MouseDoubleClick

        mousePoint = myMap.FromLocalToLatLng(e.X, e.Y)

        If tbarZoom.Value < tbarZoom.Maximum Then
            If currentMapMarker.IsVisible Then

                If myMap.Zoom < myMap.MaxZoom Then
                    myMap.Position = mousePoint
                    currentMapMarker.Position = myMap.Position
                    tbarZoom.Value += 1
                Else
                    myMap.Position = mousePoint
                    currentMapMarker.Position = myMap.Position
                End If

            End If

        Else
            myMap.Position = mousePoint
            currentMapMarker.Position = myMap.Position
        End If

    End Sub
    Private Sub tbarZoom_ValueChanged(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles tbarZoom.ValueChanged
                myMap.Zoom = tbarZoom.Value
    End Sub
I'm assigning myMap.Zoom the value of a trackbar.

This works when a mouse calls the double click event, doesnt work when touch screen calls double click event.

Any ideas?
